Jmeter log + project jmx

While controller generates an exception when there is no sampler executed.
See project file. The while consists of an if block, a timer and a disabled dummy sampler.
When the dummysampler is ENABLED there is no exception.
When the dummysampler is DISABLED and the if block is not executed, an exception occurs.
When the dummysampler is disabled but the if blocks child sampler is executed no exception is raised.
So it seems that the while controller has an issue when no active sampler is executed.
The use case is that the if block is executed at an interval. A workaround is adding a dummy sampler in the while block, but that is sub optimal.

See attached jmeter.log and example project.
